meanings.definition: Leaner or more slender in form or figure.
meanings.sent1: The lanker cat easily squeezed through the narrow gap.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the lanker branches for her art project.
meanings.sent3: The lanker model had to eat a lot to gain weight for the role.
meanings.sent4: His lanker frame made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The lanker tree swayed gracefully in the wind.

meanings.definition: More unpleasant or disagreeable in taste or smell.
meanings.sent1: The lanker soup left a bitter taste in her mouth.
meanings.sent2: The lanker cheese had a strong odor that filled the room.
meanings.sent3: Despite its lanker smell, the dish was surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: The lanker aroma of the garbage bin made her cringe.
meanings.sent5: The lanker milk had turned sour and was undrinkable.

meanings.definition: More sluggish or slow in movement.
meanings.sent1: The lanker turtle took its time crossing the road.
meanings.sent2: The lanker sloth lazily moved through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The lanker snail won the race by a slow and steady pace.
meanings.sent4: His lanker steps echoed in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The lanker river flowed gently through the valley.
